WYSIWYM.model
Class Anchor

java.lang.Object
  WYSIWYM.model.Anchor
Direct Known Subclasses:
QueryResultAnchor, SummationAnchor, TemplateAnchor, TestAnchor
public class Anchor
extends Object

Anchor represents the expansion points in the feedback text. It holds a node in the semantic graph and a list of compulsory and optional properties. If any properties are compulsory (i.e. minimum cardinality > 1) the anchor is red.

Version:
1.1 26-10-2006, 1.2 27-02-2008
Author:
Feikje Hielkema

Constructor Detail

Anchor

public Anchor()
Default constructor

Anchor

public Anchor(OntologyReader r,
              OntClass c,
              SGNode n,
              String userID)
       throws BadAnchorException
Create a new anchor for the given node, specifying which relations it must or can have. Relations whose maximum cardinality constraint is already fullfilled are not added to the menu.

Parameters:
r - OntologyReader to extract information from ontology
c - OntClass corresponding to this anchor
n - SGNode for which this anchor is created
userID - UserID
Throws:
BadAnchorException - if the given SGNode does not need an anchor

Anchor

public Anchor(OntologyReader r,
              OntClass c,
              SGNode n,
              boolean query,
              String userID)
       throws BadAnchorException
Create a new anchor for the given node, specifying which relations it must or can have. Relations whose maximum cardinality constraint is already fullfilled are not added to the menu.

Parameters:
r - OntologyReader to extract information from ontology
c - OntClass corresponding to this anchor
n - SGNode for which this anchor is created
query - true if this is an anchor for a node in the QueryGraph
userID - UserID
Throws:
BadAnchorException - if the given SGNode does not need an anchor

init

public void init(OntClass c,
                 boolean query)
          throws BadAnchorException
Initialises the anchor, finding the node's compulsory and optional properties and their NL representations and ordering it all in lists and maps, using the submenus.

Parameters:
c - OntClass corresponding to this anchor
query - true if this is an anchor for a node in the QueryGraph
Throws:
BadAnchorException - if the given SGNode does not need an anchor

getURI

public String getURI()
If the node in this anchor has a URI where its resource can be found, this method returns that URI, otherwise null.

Returns:
String URI of resource represented by the node
